item.title: Jeffrey R. Holland, next in line to lead Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, dies at 85
item.description: Jeffrey R. Holland led the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, a key governing body. He was next in line to become the church's president.

item.title: Amanda Seyfried's tally for 2025: 3 starring roles, 2 Golden Globe nominations
item.description: Amanda Seyfried is up for a Golden Globe for her performance in The Testament of Ann Lee, a movie musical about the leader of the Shakers, the 18th-century religious movement that preached celibacy, gender and racial equality, and pacifism.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV calls for a ceasefire in all conflicts in first Christmas Mass
item.description: Thousands of people gathered in Bethlehem's Manger Square as Pope Leo XIV celebrated his first Christmas Mass and called for a ceasefire in all conflicts this Christmas.

item.title: How the clergy has rallied against the Trump administration's immigration policies
item.description: Religious leaders have rallied against the Trump administration's detention and deportation of immigrants. Clergy are filing lawsuits, accompanying migrants to court hearings and leading protests.

item.title: Despite Vatican-Israel tensions, Catholics and Jews work to build trust in Haifa
item.description: Religious leaders started getting together after Oct. 7, 2023, in the hope of preventing a repeat of Arab-Jewish violence that erupted after a previous conflict in Gaza two years earlier.

item.description: Despite tensions between the Vatican and Israel's government over the Gaza war, some Jews and Christians living in Israel are trying to build trust between their communities.

item.title: Church of England launches holiday ad to counter far-right Christian nationalism
item.description: Christian nationalists vow to put "Christ back into Christmas." In response, the Church of England has launched a holiday ad campaign to counter the far-right appropriation of Christian symbols.

item.title: Pope Leo summons cardinals for a key assembly to help him govern Catholic Church
item.description: Pope Leo XIV has summoned the world's cardinals for two days of meetings to help him govern the church, in the clearest sign yet that the new year will signal the unofficial start of his pontificate.

item.title: Austrian nuns await word from the Vatican on whether they can stay in their convent
item.description: The three octogenarian nuns broke out of a nursing home to go back to live in their convent, sparking a dispute with their church superior. Both sides have appealed to the Vatican for a resolution.
